alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 11:50PM CDT until June 06 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following counties, Butler and Cowley. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall. Flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Arkansas City, Winfield, Andover, Augusta, Rose Hill, Douglass, Towanda, Benton, Udall, Whitewater, Leon, Burden, Potwin, Dexter, Elbing, Burns, Atlanta, Geuda Springs and Latham.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
